Create Harmonized Health Diagnosis Variables

create_health_diagnoses.Rd

This function takes a dataframe with a column of raw health diagnoses (prior_diagnosis) in Malagasy or local terms, and returns a modified dataframe with three new variables:

  • diagnosis_english: a harmonized, readable label in English

  • diagnosis_icd10_category: a corresponding broad ICD-10 category name

  • diagnosis_icd10_code: the ICD-10 code range (e.g., "K00–K95")

Usage

create_health_diagnoses(df, diagnosis_lookup = malagasy_diagnosis_lookup_table)

Arguments

df

A dataframe containing a column prior_diagnosis with free-text or categorical health terms.

Value

A dataframe with additional columns: diagnosis_english, diagnosis_icd10_category, and diagnosis_icd10_code.

Details

The mappings are based on field-specific translations and align with global health reporting frameworks such as DHIS2 and ICD-10 Chapter-level groupings.

Examples

health_data_ %>%
  create_health_diagnoses() -> health_data_
#> Error in left_join(., diagnosis_lookup, by = c(diagnoses_all = "raw")): could not find function "left_join"

health_data_ %>%
  summary()
#> Error: object 'health_data_' not found
